intro: Ruellia ciliosa var. humilis, commonly known as the small-flowered ruellia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and pairs of opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular, blue to purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Ruellia ciliosa var. humilis is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and flowering display.
